page.title: 20THE LIFE OF A PENSIONER
page.content: It is July 1985 and I live in Appleby in the old aged pensioner bungalows on Paul Lane. There are no shops or a post office but we have two post boxes. I have to go to{Scunthorpe to collect my pension from the post office there and I go to{Winterton}to} the clinic if I want to see a doctor. The buses run through the village four times a day and I have a pass which enables me to travel to Scunthorpe for 40p. The{milkman}brings our milk four times a week, whilst the{butcher}calls twice a week and a{fish van}and{fruit {van}once a week. My day starts at about eight in the morning when I do my housework and gardening. I go to the over 60's club once a month where we play whist or bingo and have a cup of tea. I go to church at St Bartholomews in Appleby.
